Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.adt.bqs

Class Queue_Array<Item>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.adt.bqs.Queue_Array<Item>
Type Parameters:
Item - the underlying type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Queue<Item>, Iterable<Item>
public class Queue_Array<Item> extends Object implements Queue<Item>
Class to represent a circular queue.

  • Constructor Details

    • Queue_Array

      public Queue_Array(Item[] items, int i, int j)
      Primary constructor of a queue using an array representation.
      Parameters:
      items - the initial array of items for the queue
      i - the starting index of the queue
      j - the ending index representing the next available position in the queue

    • Queue_Array

      public Queue_Array(int n)
      Secondary constructor of a new Queue_Array with a specified initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      n - the initial capacity of the queue (must be a non-negative integer, the number of elements the queue can initially store)

  • Method Details

    • offer

      public void offer(Item item)
      Adds the specified item to the queue. The method places the item at the end of the queue, adjusts the internal array index, and ensures there is enough room for future items by possibly resizing the internal array.
      Specified by:
      offer in interface Queue<Item>
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add to the queue

    • poll

      public Item poll()
      Retrieves and removes the item at the front of the queue. If the queue is empty, returns null.
      Specified by:
      poll in interface Queue<Item>
      Returns:
      the item at the front of the queue, or null if the queue is empty

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Specified by:
      isEmpty in interface Queue<Item>
      Returns:
      true if this stack is empty

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Item> iterator()
      Returns an iterator over elements of type T.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Item>
      Returns:
      an Iterator.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements currently stored in the queue. The size is calculated based on the difference between the head (i) and tail (j) indices modulo the capacity (n) of the queue.
      Returns:
      the number of elements in the queue
